1534    /**
1535     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that distorts the map as it nears the poles, expanding the
1536     * smaller-diameter latitude lines in extreme north and south regions so they take up the same space as the equator;
1537     * this counteracts certain artifacts that are common in Simplex noise world maps by using a 4D noise call to
1538     * generate terrain, using a normal 3D noise call's result as the extra 4th dimension. This generator allows
1539     * choosing a {@link Noise3D}, which is used for most of the generation. This is ideal for projecting onto a 3D
1540     * sphere, which could squash the poles to counteract the stretch this does. You might also want to produce an oval
1541     * map that more-accurately represents the changes in the diameter of a latitude line on a spherical world; you
1542     * should use {@link EllipticalMap} or {@link EllipticalHammerMap} for this.
1543     * {@link HyperellipticalMap} is also a nice option because it can project onto a shape between a
1544     * rectangle (like this class) and an ellipse (like EllipticalMap), with all-round sides.
1545     * <a href="http://i.imgur.com/wth01QD.png">Example map, showing distortion</a>
1546     */
1547    @Beta
1548    public static class SphereMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1549        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1550        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1551        private double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1552                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1553                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1554
1555        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1556        public final double[][] xPositions,
1557                yPositions,
1558                zPositions;
1559
1560
1561        /**
1562         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1563         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1564         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1565         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
1566         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1567         * If you were using {@link SphereMap#SphereMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1568         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1569         */
1570        public SphereMap() {
1571            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1572        }

1574        /**
1575         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1576         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1577         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1578         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1579         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1580         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1581         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1582         *
1583         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1584         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1585         */
1586        public SphereMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1587            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1588        }

1590        /**
1591         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1592         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1593         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1594         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1595         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1596         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1597         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1598         *
1599         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1600         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1601         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1602         */
1603        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1604            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1605        }

1607        /**
1608         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1609         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1610         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1611         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1612         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1613         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1614         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
1615         *
1616         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1617         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1618         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1619         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1620         */
1621        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
1622            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
1623        }

1625        /**
1626         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1627         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1628         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1629         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1630         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1631         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1632         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1633         *
1634         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1635         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1636         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1637         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1638         */
1639        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {

1642
1643        /**
1644         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1645         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1646         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1647         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
1648         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
1649         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
1650         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
1651         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
1652         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
1653         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
1654         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
1655         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
1656         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
1657         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
1658         * that don't require zooming.
1659         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1660         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1661         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1662         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
1663         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1664         */
1665        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
1666            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
1667            xPositions = new double[width][height];
1668            yPositions = new double[width][height];
1669            zPositions = new double[width][height];
1670
1671            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
1672            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
1673            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
1674            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
1675            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
1676        }
1677        @Override
1678        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
1679            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1680        }
1681
1682        /**
1683         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
1684         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
1685         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
1686         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
1687         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
1688         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
1689         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
1690         * @param latitude the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
1691         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
1692         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
1693         */
1694        @Override
1695        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
1696            int x = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * 0.15915494309189535 * width + 0.5),
1697                    y = (int)((NumberTools.sin(latitude) * 0.5 + 0.5) * height + 0.5);
1698            return Coord.get(
1699                    wrapX(x, y),
1700                    wrapY(x, y));
1701        }

1703        /**
1704         * Copies the SphereMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only be
1705         * shared to Noise classes.
1706         * @param other a SphereMap to copy
1707         */
1708        public SphereMap(SphereMap other)
1709        {
1710            super(other);
1711            terrain = other.terrain;
1712            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
1713            heat = other.heat;
1714            moisture = other.moisture;
1715            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
1716            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
1717            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
1718            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
1719            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
1720            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
1721            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
1722            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
1723            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
1724            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
1725        }
1726
1727        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
1728                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
1729        {
1730            boolean fresh = false;
1731            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
1732            {
1733                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1734                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1735                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1736                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1737                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1738                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1739                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1740                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1741                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1742                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1743                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1744                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1745                cacheA = stateA;
1746                cacheB = stateB;
1747                fresh = true;
1748            }
1749            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
1750            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
1751            int t;
1752
1753            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
1754            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
1755
1756            double p,
1757                    ps, pc,
1758                    qs, qc,
1759                    h, temp,
1760                    i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 2.0 / (height+2.0),//(3.141592653589793) / (height+2.0),
1761                    xPos = startX, yPos, i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h / (height+2.0);
1762            final double[] trigTable = new double[width << 1];
1763            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
1764                p = xPos * i_w + centerLongitude;
1765                trigTable[x<<1]   = NumberTools.sin(p);
1766                trigTable[x<<1|1] = NumberTools.cos(p);
1767            }
1768            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1769            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1770                qs = -1 + yPos;//-1.5707963267948966 + yPos;
1771                qc = NumberTools.cos(NumberTools.asin(qs));
1772                //qs = qs;
1773                //qs = NumberTools.sin(qs);
1774                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++) {
1775                    ps = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.sin(p);
1776                    pc = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.cos(p);
1777                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
1778                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
1779                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
1780                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
1781                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
1782                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
1783                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
1784                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
1785                            , qs, seedB));
1786                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
1787                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
1788                            , seedC));
1789
1790                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
1791                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
1792                    if(fresh) {
1793                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
1794                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
1795
1796                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
1797                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
1798
1799                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
1800                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
1801                    }
1802                }
1803                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
1804                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
1805
1806            }
1807            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
1808                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
1809                    hMod;
1810            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1811            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1812            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1813
1814            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1815                temp = Math.abs(yPos - 1.0);
1816                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
1817                temp = 2.2 - temp;
1818                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1819//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
1820//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
1821//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);

1828                        case 2:
1829                        case 3:

1831                            hMod = 0.2;
1832                            break;
1833                        case 6:
1834                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
1835                            break;
1836                        case 7:
1837                            h *= -0.25;
1838                            break;
1839                        case 8:
1840                            h *= -0.4;
1841                            break;
1842                        default:
1843                            h *= 0.05;
1844                    }
1845                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
1846                    if (fresh) {
1847                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
1848                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
1849                    }
1850                }
1851            }

1853            {
1854                minHeat1 = ps;
1855                maxHeat1 = pc;
1856            }

1860            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1861            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1862
1863
1864            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1865                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1866                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
1867                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
1868                    if (fresh) {
1869                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
1870                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
1871                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
1872                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
1873                    }
1874                }
1875            }
1876            if(fresh)
1877            {
1878                minHeat = qs;
1879                maxHeat = qc;
1880                minWet = ps;
1881                maxWet = pc;
1882            }
1883            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);

1929    /**
1930     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
1931     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
1932     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mollweide_projection">Mollweide projection</a>.
1933     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/BBKrKjI.png" >Example map, showing ellipse shape</a>
1934     */
1935    @Beta
1936    public static class EllipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1937        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1938        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1939        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1940                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1941                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1942
1943        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1944        public final double[][] xPositions,
1945                yPositions,
1946                zPositions;
1947        protected final int[] edges;
1948

1950        /**
1951         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1952         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1953         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
1954         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1955         * If you were using {@link EllipticalMap#EllipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1956         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1957         */
1958        public EllipticalMap() {
1959            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1960        }

1962        /**
1963         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1964         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1965         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1966         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1967         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1968         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1969         *
1970         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1971         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1972         */
1973        public EllipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1974            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1975        }

1977        /**
1978         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1979         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1980         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1981         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1982         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1983         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1984         *
1985         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1986         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1987         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1988         */
1989        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1990            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1991        }

1993        /**
1994         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1995         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1996         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1997         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1998         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1999         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2000         *
2001         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2002         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2003         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2004         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2005         */
2006        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2007            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2008        }

2010        /**
2011         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2012         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2013         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2014         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2015         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2016         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
2017         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
2018         *
2019         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2020         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2021         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2022         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2023         */
2024        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2025            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2026        }
2027
2028        /**
2029         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2030         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2031         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
2032         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
2033         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2034         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2035         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2036         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2037         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2038         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2039         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2040         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2041         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2042         * that don't require zooming.
2043         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2044         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2045         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2046         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2047         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2048         */
2049        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2050            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2051            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2052            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2053            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2054            edges = new int[height << 1];
2055            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
2056            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
2057            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
2058            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
2059            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
2060        }
2061
2062        /**
2063         * Copies the EllipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2064         * be shared to Noise classes.
2065         * @param other an EllipticalMap to copy
2066         */
2067        public EllipticalMap(EllipticalMap other)
2068        {
2069            super(other);
2070            terrain = other.terrain;
2071            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
2072            heat = other.heat;
2073            moisture = other.moisture;
2074            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
2075            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
2076            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
2077            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
2078            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
2079            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
2080            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
2081            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
2082            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
2083            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
2084            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
2085        }
2086
2087        @Override
2088        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2089            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2090            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2091                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2092            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2093                return edges[y << 1];
2094            else return x;
2095        }
2096
2097        @Override
2098        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2099            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2100        }
2101
2102        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2103                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2104        {
2105            boolean fresh = false;
2106            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2107            {
2108                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2109                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2110                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2111                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2112                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2113                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2114                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2115                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2116                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2117                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2118                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2119                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2120                cacheA = stateA;
2121                cacheB = stateB;
2122                fresh = true;
2123            }
2124            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2125            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2126            int t;
2127
2128            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2129            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2130
2131            double p,
2132                    ps, pc,
2133                    qs, qc,
2134                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2135                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2136                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2137                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2138                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2139                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2140
2141            yPos = startY - ry;
2142            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2143                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2144                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2145                thy = thx * 2.0;
2146                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2147
2148                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2149                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2150
2151                boolean inSpace = true;
2152                xPos = startX;
2153                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2154                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2155                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2156                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2157                        inSpace = true;
2158                        continue;
2159                    }
2160                    if(inSpace)
2161                    {
2162                        inSpace = false;
2163                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2164                    }
2165                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2166                    th += centerLongitude;
2167                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2168                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2169                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2170                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2171                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2172                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2173                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2174                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2175                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2176                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2177                            , qs, seedB));
2178                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2179                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2180                            , seedC));
2181                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2182                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2183                    if(fresh) {
2184                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2185                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2186
2187                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2188                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2189
2190                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2191                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2192                    }
2193                }
2194                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2195                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2196
2197            }
2198            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2199                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2200                    hMod,
2201                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2202            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2203            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2204            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2205
2206            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2207                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2208                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2209                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2210                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2211                    h = heightData[x][y];
2212                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2213                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2214                        continue;
2215                    }
2216                    else
2217                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2218                    hMod = 1.0;
2219                    switch (t) {
2220                        case 0:
2221                        case 1:
2222                        case 2:
2223                        case 3:
2224                            h = 0.4;
2225                            hMod = 0.2;
2226                            break;
2227                        case 6:
2228                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2229                            break;
2230                        case 7:
2231                            h *= -0.25;
2232                            break;
2233                        case 8:
2234                            h *= -0.4;
2235                            break;
2236                        default:
2237                            h *= 0.05;
2238                    }
2239                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2240                    if (fresh) {
2241                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2242                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2243                    }
2244                }
2245            }
2246            if(fresh)
2247            {
2248                minHeat1 = ps;
2249                maxHeat1 = pc;
2250            }
2251            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2252            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2253            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2254            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2255            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2256
2257
2258            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2259                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2260                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2261                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2262                    if (fresh) {
2263                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2264                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2265                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2266                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2267                    }
2268                }
2269            }
2270            if(fresh)
2271            {
2272                minHeat = qs;
2273                maxHeat = qc;
2274                minWet = ps;
2275                maxWet = pc;
2276            }
2277            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2278        }
2279    }

2281    /**
2282     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing map (such as a map of Earth, which it can do by default). It
2283     * uses the Mollweide projection (an elliptical map projection, the same as what EllipticalMap uses) for both its
2284     * input and output; <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/MimicWorld.png">an example can be seen here</a>,
2285     * imitating Earth using a 512x256 world map as a GreasedRegion for input.
2286     */
2287    public static class MimicMap extends EllipticalMap
2288    {
2289        public GreasedRegion earth;
2290        public GreasedRegion shallow;

2338         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
2339         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2340         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2341         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2342         *

2344         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2345         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2346         */

2351        /**
2352         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2353         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2354         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
2355         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
2356         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
2357         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
2358         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
2359         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
2360         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
2361         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2362         *
2363         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2364         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2365         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2366         */
2367        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2368            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2369        }
2370
2371        /**
2372         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2373         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2374         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
2375         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
2376         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
2377         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2378         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2379         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2380         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2381         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2382         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2383         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2384         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2385         * that don't require zooming.
2386         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2387         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2388         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2389         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2390         */
2391        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2392            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
2393            earth = toMimic;
2394            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
2395            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
2396            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
2397        }

\u0DFD紨礉氟䯜᪪惝䝼⡐劫䉵ገ\u10C9㓄礻㪗弽䂹⨴炧ẙ槦Ⅎ㊶᠂嬫䡘⓬ĳ県犖僂⒙梳ᣔ扢卑䬠Ү移寝ⰼṔ珜岳䄥ፃ卒ὡာ磑㤍ᆲ梼操㧸ᭁ甩䅮掲ⓢ̰壞✄Ḅ嬸畦抖ᥢ䰱慿⭂⻙Ⓖ擂䔕Ӑᑣ磏î̳ỂႿ⬫ᥙ檴攁䍅ᖁ缀刳̢ͼ䪼㔚戭ᩳ⏢╭㏌ᝨ㿈呰Ꮲ塣⨼瓈̲㳳粴渥⡳䞸猩ֆ㈼Ձ渤汙䌢\u1C4Cⓢⱪ猦㕙↴ヹ䚻宬ڻ䅮熺⍒㊼ᢃ⤛̀㯨᜴䋤ԑֺ䔂擌ܙ儠唰䍔൰崽ぽɈᵀᒨҔ时ⷳ挱ぷ槸ὀ澭Ʉ䩅ሀ⌨摯\u0AF4\u08C0綱哆犲䢀ᘤ㑙晤ᡅ桉㖌捍ὠ泫⳥杳ᓌ慯梃僇ྐ\u0EEDٷⓞᓀޱ㔓箅叁勡喔牾㫠ስ䅜⋾㬓潁⡛ةဉ濧ޜ厠䛔㫨慮݈Ɠ瞶ぎ䤽॓ḧ嵄爁ń囬奢簎⠒倈泤䍫ਬ䡄䞔\u087Aᓒ峆㕊\u0866᧘◪癡㬾⑀痫潂⡧᪀㊣䌆摡㥴䛢溊ᓤᜂᨧ亀䀷ᤪ溭渵昗Č哋㳵↑ⳙᖸ癭犖呪ᓂ灠⎎ᜉ狭佣㣄ह⬲喂५౫ᓂ勩\u1737\u05F8㉳ࡍᒡ\u0DE9ᛂጝᕉ≫ᱵ⋓ᕟ᭪厵磆昁⥴↠狳ᗗᳫ六睵䖟ᩨ汹犮ቱ⟫无勻ក䧌ܺ˶ᒙ\u2D78并助梉\u3101㱶棝â᠌\u2073挤噊䥊慾ᴨ⇅㫉Χ䴙ᗙ㜪ռ\u0884唎䈔ঈ⌁ၴ䕀糥⪰嘵㿠彤̦啚䰹✼で䌹崥止⋳Ⱈ㲫嘭欛歲ᇋ毮ᑂ䦧Ῐ䢡ℑ戺ㆢ人唉囁俰⋮硊䏓丁㸎礿䋘ᶋ纽畠枍㟋㭼∥坓\u1CA5丩㥱⌄\u23F9䤺⢶䝽㚊絶牛ਐ䡤殹╭ᇍ㮲罅欈䊱彁ᎄ\u0E7A⟘ᜱ㻭䣕嘢ㄲ㴿䨰筬\u0A3B撍♓䂴ტ歬ぉઽ㿨㘎䋵䯔͇ᢩ嵶ᬮᓩ巩偡⏈䨀䷪窫磏䤜ち✆᭘ߨ㓳䜟响啄俌䙓吮䶔⠹沼㊓⼉峿\u0893ႸӠԂ梓℃㫉滦ˁ祐䨪勵⚾㗫ⵕ¤嚮懸䬄\u1FB5䍏柱ኺⲋ嚯䭋䊼Ӻᢶ\u08B2⋳┦欺ᩌ\u1C81㾀溚ᇔඅ┥䊷㞅䷻⸉盔\u09D1͘剸狿᠘ᗻᘮಘᯣႪ佻盧掘啋૮㠸甛⊈⠅䦖兙ᅉ⨍湓¼ᘀ癍ौ爧㙛廭沢⦣ૈ⁼灳䋤წⳡ䐪睧ૠ姿\u0EFA疈䴥㋨Ὠ⃡ፚ燳\u2EFC痦⊢嗩\u243E䚜ᷛᘋܫÐ㮩叁⚭㦪ࠢ俇\u1CB5ᅯ⡍函䮂䈞⁝⚄拵盱\u1C4C乧㱽焙帹㏾欣痎⤚\u16FA弐ϓ匀ⶢሬ䛝ਫ▉娴嬑候啯㫡䉝㖀㡌绎倠ⵀ兩㢲悌ᰛ\u1AFD累ኡ怌叹紑䇳䋻ห禌反Ꮣ攥䖈✖⸧ၰ䈟瑻㽻㢢҃䇵˙⪮䖘᩹Ⴇᦀ縦妈ዌ棲悥䐟ᙱ㑀瘱䃇Ń矡䚸寵䕡ඈ⚧Ű䯕ᄠ塵卟㗤活㡧˥䌚≻⡹歖ᵀ帣炨⊠ᷘ曩倣⨆㓀ⳍⅿ扚䅪橐䮆䊈抣㪾䒇瞍Ꮵ⤦Ṟ\u0FF1⠔᱄䞅晸斬ᩊ䡯棹㟘癶䚈樧㺚䶮㙰䭗㧹杂楥⛈汈㹓㡍\u0E5F㾐䱘噱໐抌⧴™સ孱䮵Ҷ䃩ṱ⩠皆ᑉ⧭㡷ᒇ΄Ⴆ⢎&\u2BE1ః≧ぃ̲᳀俾⨆亠东ଯ⠠㈬䈨甠\u0D54⤒ᯘ浟硩㮯㸼劬䉳⡔\u0C04㪫田≹֪叢槰揔檇㕃抒॥䛰汫砨愲\u1CACᔢ殆䲵㎇ፚ廐痝⸨㏡ʋ扚ሑⵋ咙ᯠ䌴咷\u088A㤜\u087Bᙌ్\u0CD4䳰偗ᡈ䘼Ї㡥秠䥇ކ⩦砺䎘Ⲉ偁媀檍چ枹בᮜ楙㝒ͳ䈬១唬吨ⱝ䮁僙剸ⶤɉ⺫౩扆䴓漥煼↮ᴧ㽕ᅥᨪૠ愤䀯⦡ა繛㉁䫼掷⚬ᐾ⸌綕泇㓢㩍ሃ厼\u2437↲\u08CDᢴ犉᭪潉㋝ᢶ矂ỹڳ幮䞸᭔\u1ADB㦩䖊\u0A31䫘偩ⷊ棶㸷ᘎ䔏㱶⫐㘕\u2EFA灐枩䱍\u23FAា囚⦻⾛㛁\u206Aಞ䄌䤠ⲻ䡸ͨ悻晣皹⎵㒈瞭喃㥢㓹ᇔᜂღ懜勯㑐淄ɖ嶶䷄眷䭗⇙的渆汭Ӹⷬ求䓗䜄玅塜媳给兢瑵ᄠ㱄孉竒㏭毡䷶濺ޤط桤敘ᄘ抯伊淖昢\u2B5A硳朗ۆ称䩧掦వ淙祁淮璖煡ᶫ㡄ఁᙉ〰护ୠ狞᷅汫䗉ࠠ㸅⬾洛ௗ䨫潊ዥ咣樳䋄勓痻捺㧭༲\u2FD6嵠䂸ЖᏒ\u1B4D叮㙴嬡ڵ䥣Ì䇡ḓ券䎁悞灨ṹᅠ゜淸泝ᠹ⇑ΰ竁攜握䷠㍴済㢜䏜ᱱമቑ䏬ㅿ✹凃᥀校᪐杓⏆㈰䷚ಔᔓ͑稳犎䶠渕ႃ᳖ᗎẊេ挩ē៷\u3103˭瑎᳁̺硒❓清۵勽⛏䌶ᅯ㲒吚矵㰊¤䁿䍠ৡफ籮䏾戢♺湗㆜Ӯ⡥⠫ᴔ廛₵छ⁙泯湫澍济瓺䄉ᐃᷥ凯暟⺙凕ᵺ᰿噀已௯些玾筀ℌደ䙯Ῐᑎ㺕㏈Ņ皍⦜\u0BD8嶥歏ᆑ̈忚哮娀噎䊒⢩\u2E6A暡䭡ᥰ媲ࡂ䫲羥ᩪ犇竷䌪廖籣傝嫇磪爣涂嘀ᒯ䞓ޅ罪㇠硺\u2BA5籽䓮摴䊹擠㔡批⧈⓹籡偹ᘧ\u19DB冦緊ෛ䭇殔ᔽ䋴ᮏ晸㘺䔴䠕❣桄ˀ倔䊨䖜㢫θ寺碉眂䃭仫㐖瀧ḏ៷ښὋ\u09C6´䏌⌍搯㙆ϰ㿰⬽孡䉆䴣仔\u08E0߲ᆞ皈椘䙫ᝣ甥ѡ㊧握昦瑨⟏掣璯ᄘࠐጣ笾睾篳ⸯ㒿ۢᘇ尳烹㊧呖歓樿妧ᐁㄡह㊛䱊愃我ᴛ⢝⇄みᙶ䌥㙱୰ིࠊ懊\u08D0峓承ŉẹ睤ᰤⶴͥ瓿㹰棈伉⡪ቨ䶂ᖑ烒⡕Ḏᖙ⎼\u086Dཱྀ亾恝㠗\u08CE囕厦ཇ噇䞐掙㡬厄\u23FAア⒘㙋瑾婿砉䈗ᅈఎⱵ䵊\u0A61೫䘹恐䊩ᘈ䚐排ᭀ༧⩅ଃ\u175F䖡᭢ᙝ湄峐䩓呭敁ӗ⡰协ㅡ丣煛\u1FDCዃ喺惇ਭ㠩㸌䘳勸ܓ▢倿㫵⨁窺{\u0AE5ὈŔ⡥䄋с㺎ᢪጽ֢㎚㚊₮Χょኗ㓶ө㑰⒒箠๐⍯尔\u2BE5ᕤ̯䴭∘橡ጐ䄦峊ᔨ反әᭃḸ廪㭚桖婀㏂测搀⧡㏑洡㺚慡㓘ٰ晡Մ☴₇䈤̤㖑怢⣱\u0885儸▀夒倳榯\u2451ᐨ≲\u0096‑䴡⣫偉ᤌ\u20BBफ़懡糣燀Ź獪\u0D5AŰ煀\u08B2倣⃜ど姐潀戢ধ㨦ě࿚㒭䔲䆰房䤫 䜘ඹ媋氢盵䌛䒈྄㗢⢣\u0D81ᄎ旄ੜ䛪傭᱘汞㉀℁Υ淡爰䖅攍Ꮀ寄眡पᦿ瀣ψ\u0EE2ͱⰷ\u18AF甴↝凞\u0EF2cĤⅇ㡵⤘ณ\u0B00㿗\u0B3Aሯ¬⌠⫪☙䭍䌢䣶䂸႖㗡ŀǪՀဠᕓŸ⡃巍捝ङ⥍䌈ଥℬ㈤䈳儁\u0094ᛊ老ᛣ㿔⢉妭⚧ō䇃ᴨၓㅱĮᝂ篙Ϭㅞ\u202A祢䞈\u1DF9祣穥 2414        /**
2415         * Copies the MimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2416         * be shared to Noise classes.
2417         * @param other a MimicMap to copy
2418         */
2419        public MimicMap(MimicMap other)
2420        {
2421            super(other);
2422            earth = other.earth.copy();
2423            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
2424            coast   = other.coast.copy();
2425            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
2426        }

2429
2430        /**
2431         * Meant for making maps conform to the Mollweide (elliptical) projection that MimicMap uses.
2432         * @param rectangular A GreasedRegion where "on" represents land and "off" water, using any rectangular projection
2433         * @return a reprojected version of {@code rectangular} that uses an elliptical projection
2434         */
2435        public static GreasedRegion reprojectToElliptical(GreasedRegion rectangular) {
2436            int width = rectangular.width, height = rectangular.height;
2437            GreasedRegion t = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
2438            double yPos, xPos,
2439                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2440                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2441                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2442    
2443            yPos = -ry;
2444            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos++) {
2445                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2446                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2447                thy = thx * 2.0;
2448                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2449                xPos = 0;
2450                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos++) {
2451                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2452                    if (th >= -3.141592653589793 && th <= 3.141592653589793
2453                            && rectangular.contains((int) ((th + 1) * hw), (int) ((lat + 1) * ry))) {
2454                        t.insert(x, y);
2455                    }
2456                }
2457            }
2458            return t;
2459        }

2461        @Override
2462        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2463            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2464            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2465                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2466            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2467                return edges[y << 1];
2468            else return x;
2469        }
2470
2471        @Override
2472        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2473            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2474        }

2476        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2477                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2478        {
2479            boolean fresh = false;
2480            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2481            {
2482                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2483                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2484                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2485                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2486                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2487                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2488                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2489                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2490                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2491                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2492                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2493                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2494                cacheA = stateA;
2495                cacheB = stateB;
2496                fresh = true;
2497            }
2498            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2499            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2500            int t;
2501
2502            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
2503            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2504
2505            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
2506
2507            if(zoom > 0)
2508            {
2509                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
2510                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
2511                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
2512                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
2513                }
2514                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2515                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2516            }
2517            else
2518            {
2519                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
2520                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
2521            }
2522            double p,
2523                    ps, pc,
2524                    qs, qc,
2525                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2526                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2527                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2528                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2529                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2530                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2531            yPos = startY - ry;
2532            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2533
2534                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2535                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2536                thy = thx * 2.0;
2537                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2538
2539                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2540                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2541
2542                boolean inSpace = true;
2543                xPos = startX;
2544                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2545                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2546                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2547                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2548                        inSpace = true;
2549                        continue;
2550                    }
2551                    if(inSpace)
2552                    {
2553                        inSpace = false;
2554                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2555                    }
2556                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2557//                    th += centerLongitude;
2558                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2559                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2560                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2561                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2562                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2563                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
2564                    {
2565                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2566                                ps, qs, seedA)) * 0.85;
2567                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
2568                            h += 0.05;
2569                        else
2570                            h += 0.15;
2571                    }
2572                    else
2573                    {
2574                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2575                                ps, qs, seedA)) * -0.9;
2576                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
2577                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
2578                        else
2579                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
2580                    }
2581                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
2582                    heightData[x][y] = h;
2583                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2584                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2585                            , qs, seedB));
2586                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2587                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2588                            , seedC));
2589                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2590                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2591                    if(fresh) {
2592                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2593                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2594
2595                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2596                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2597
2598                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2599                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2600                    }
2601                }
2602                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2603                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2604
2605            }
2606            double heightDiff = 2.0 / (maxHeightActual - minHeightActual),
2607                    heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2608                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2609                    hMod,
2610                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / (halfHeight);
2611            double minHeightActual0 = minHeightActual;
2612            double maxHeightActual0 = maxHeightActual;
2613            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2614            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2615            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2616
2617            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2618                temp = Math.pow(Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half, 1.5);
2619                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2620                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2621                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2622//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
2623//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
2624//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
2625                    h = heightData[x][y];
2626                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2627                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2628                        continue;
2629                    }
2630                    else
2631                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2632                    hMod = 1.0;
2633                    switch (t) {
2634                        case 0:
2635                        case 1:
2636                        case 2:
2637                        case 3:
2638                            h = 0.4;
2639                            hMod = 0.2;
2640                            break;
2641                        case 6:
2642                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2643                            break;
2644                        case 7:
2645                            h *= -0.25;
2646                            break;
2647                        case 8:
2648                            h *= -0.4;
2649                            break;
2650                        default:
2651                            h *= 0.05;
2652                    }
2653                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2654                    if (fresh) {
2655                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2656                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2657                    }
2658                }
2659            }
2660            if(fresh)
2661            {
2662                minHeat1 = ps;
2663                maxHeat1 = pc;
2664            }
2665            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2666            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2667            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2668            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2669            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2670
2671
2672            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2673                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2674                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2675                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2676                    if (fresh) {
2677                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2678                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2679                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2680                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2681                    }
2682                }
2683            }
2684            if(fresh)
2685            {
2686                minHeat = qs;
2687                maxHeat = qc;
2688                minWet = ps;
2689                maxWet = pc;
2690            }
2691            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2692        }
2693
2694    }
2695    /**
2696     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
2697     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). This uses an
2698     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
2699     * the latitude always at the equator.
2700     * <a href="https://tommyettinger.github.io/DorpBorx/worlds7/index.html">Example views of 50 planets</a>.
2701     */
2702    @Beta
2703    public static class SpaceViewMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
2704        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
2705        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
2706        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2707                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2708                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2709
2710        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
2711        public final double[][] xPositions,
2712                yPositions,
2713                zPositions;
2714        protected final int[] edges;
2715
2716        /**
2717         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2718         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2719         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
2720         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2721         * If you were using {@link SpaceViewMap#SpaceViewMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2722         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
2723         */
2724        public SpaceViewMap() {
2725            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2726        }
2727
2728        /**
2729         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2730         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2731         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
2732         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
2733         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2734         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2735         *
2736         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2737         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2738         */
2739        public SpaceViewMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2740            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
2741        }
2742
2743        /**
2744         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2745         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2746         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2747         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2748         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2749         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2750         *
2751         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2752         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2753         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2754         */
2755        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2756            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2757        }
2758
2759        /**
2760         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2761         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2762         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2763         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2764         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2765         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2766         *
2767         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2768         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2769         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2770         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2771         */
2772        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2773            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2774        }
2775
2776        /**
2777         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2778         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2779         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2780         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2781         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2782         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2783         *
2784         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2785         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2786         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2787         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2788         */
2789        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2790            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2791        }
2792
2793        /**
2794         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2795         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2796         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
2797         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
2798         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2799         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2800         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2801         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2802         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2803         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2804         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2805         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2806         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2807         * that don't require zooming.
2808         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2809         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2810         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2811         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2812         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2813         */
2814        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2815            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2816            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2817            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2818            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2819            edges = new int[height << 1];
2820            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
2821            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325, 0.475);
2822//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
2823//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25, 0.475);
2824            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
2825            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
2826            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
2827        }
2828
2829        /**
2830         * Copies the SpaceViewMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2831         * be shared to Noise classes.
2832         * @param other a SpaceViewMap to copy
2833         */
2834        public SpaceViewMap(SpaceViewMap other)
2835        {
2836            super(other);
2837            terrain = other.terrain;
2838            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
2839            heat = other.heat;
2840            moisture = other.moisture;
2841            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
2842            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
2843            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
2844            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
2845            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
2846            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
2847            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
2848            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
2849            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
2850            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
2851            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
2852        }
2853        
2854        @Override
2855        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
2856            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2857            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
2858        }
2859
2860        @Override
2861        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2862            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2863        }
