2865        //private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0), inverseRoot2 = 1.0 / root2, halfInverseRoot2 = 0.5 / root2;
2866
2867        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2868                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2869        {
2870            boolean fresh = false;
2871            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2872            {
2873                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2874                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2875                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2876                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2877                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2878                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2879                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2880                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2881                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2882                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2883                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2884                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2885                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2886                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2887                cacheA = stateA;
2888                cacheB = stateB;
2889                fresh = true;
2890            }
2891            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2892            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2893            int t;
2894
2895            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2896            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2897
2898            double p,
2899                    ps, pc,
2900                    qs, qc,
2901                    h, temp, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
2902                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2903                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2904                    th, lon, lat, rho,
2905                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
2906                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
2907
2908            yPos = startY - ry;
2909            iyPos = yPos / ry;
2910            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
2911
2912                boolean inSpace = true;
2913                xPos = startX - rx;
2914                ixPos = xPos / rx;
2915                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
2916                    rho = Math.sqrt(ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
2917                    if(rho > 1.0) {
2918                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2919                        inSpace = true;
2920                        continue;
2921                    }
2922                    if(inSpace)
2923                    {
2924                        inSpace = false;
2925                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2926                    }
2927                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2928                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
2929                    lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
2930                    lon = centerLongitude + NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th));
2931
2932                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2933                    qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2934
2935                    pc = NumberTools.cos(lon) * qc;
2936                    ps = NumberTools.sin(lon) * qc;
2937
2938                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2939                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2940                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2941                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2942                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2943                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2944//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrain4D.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,
2945//                            (terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA)
2946//                                    + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC - seedB)) * 0.5,
2947//                            seedA) * landModifier);
2948                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2949                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2950                            , qs, seedB));
2951                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2952                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2953                            , seedC));
2954                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2955                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2956                    if(fresh) {
2957                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2958                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2959
2960                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2961                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2962
2963                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2964                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2965                    }
2966                }
2967                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2968                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2969
2970            }
2971            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2972                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2973                    hMod,
2974                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2975            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2976            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2977            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2978
2979            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2980                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2981                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2982                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2983                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2984                    h = heightData[x][y];
2985                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2986                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2987                        continue;
2988                    }
2989                    else
2990                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2991                    hMod = 1.0;
2992                    switch (t) {
2993                        case 0:
2994                        case 1:
2995                        case 2:
2996                        case 3:
2997                            h = 0.4;
2998                            hMod = 0.2;
2999                            break;
3000                        case 6:
3001                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3002                            break;
3003                        case 7:
3004                            h *= -0.25;
3005                            break;
3006                        case 8:
3007                            h *= -0.4;
3008                            break;
3009                        default:
3010                            h *= 0.05;
3011                    }
3012                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3013                    if (fresh) {
3014                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3015                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3016                    }
3017                }
3018            }
3019            if(fresh)
3020            {
3021                minHeat1 = ps;
3022                maxHeat1 = pc;
3023            }
3024            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3025            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3026            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3027            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3028            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3029
3030
3031            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3032                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3033                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3034                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3035                    if (fresh) {
3036                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3037                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3038                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3039                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3040                    }
3041                }
3042            }
3043            if(fresh)
3044            {
3045                minHeat = qs;
3046                maxHeat = qc;
3047                minWet = ps;
3048                maxWet = pc;
3049            }
3050            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3051        }
3052    }
3053    /**
3054     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape with a flat top
3055     * and bottom but near-circular sides. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3056     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3057     * distortion on the far left and far right edges of the map than EllipticalMap, but the flat top and bottom are
3058     * probably very distorted in a small area near the poles.
3059     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eckert_IV_projection">Eckert IV projection</a>.
3060     * <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/RoundSideWorldMap.png">Example map</a>
3061     */
3062    @Beta
3063    public static class RoundSideMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3064        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3065        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3066        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3067                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3068                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3069
3070        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3071        public final double[][] xPositions,
3072                yPositions,
3073                zPositions;
3074        protected final int[] edges;

3079         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3080         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3081         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3082         * If you were using {@link RoundSideMap#RoundSideMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3083         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.

3124         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.

3126         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3127         *
3128         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3129         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3130         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3131         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal

3139         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3140         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3141         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3142         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3143         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3144         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}
3145         *
3146         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3147         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3148         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3149         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3150         */

3155        /**
3156         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3157         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3158         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3159         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3160         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3161         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3162         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3163         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3164         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3165         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3166         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3167         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3168         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3169         * that don't require zooming.
3170         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3171         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3172         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3173         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3174         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3175         */
3176        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3177            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3178            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3179            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3180            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3181            edges = new int[height << 1];
3182            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3183            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3184//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
3185//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
3186            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3187            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3188            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3189        }

3191        /**
3192         * Copies the RoundSideMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3193         * be shared to Noise classes.
3194         * @param other a RoundSideMap to copy
3195         */
3196        public RoundSideMap(RoundSideMap other)
3197        {
3198            super(other);
3199            terrain = other.terrain;
3200            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
3201            heat = other.heat;
3202            moisture = other.moisture;
3203            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
3204            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
3205            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
3206            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
3207            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
3208            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
3209            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
3210            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
3211            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
3212            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
3213            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
3214        }

3216        @Override
3217        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3218            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3219            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3220                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3221            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3222                return edges[y << 1];
3223            else return x;
3224        }
3225
3226        @Override
3227        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3228            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3229        }
3230
3231        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3232                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3233        {
3234            boolean fresh = false;
3235            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3236            {
3237                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3238                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3239                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3240                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3241                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3242                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3243                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3244                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3245                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3246                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3247                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3248                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3249                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3250                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3251                cacheA = stateA;
3252                cacheB = stateB;
3253                fresh = true;
3254            }
3255            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3256            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3257            int t;
3258
3259            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3260            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3261
3262            double p,
3263                    ps, pc,
3264                    qs, qc,
3265                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3266                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3267                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3268                    th, thb, thx, thy, lon, lat,
3269                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.326500428177002 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3270                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3271
3272            yPos = startY - ry;
3273            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3274                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3275                thb = NumberTools.asin(thy);
3276                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3277                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3278                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3279                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3280                lat = NumberTools.asin(qs);
3281
3282                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3283
3284                boolean inSpace = true;
3285                xPos = startX - hw;
3286                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3287                    th = lon * xPos;
3288                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3289                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3290                        inSpace = true;
3291                        continue;
3292                    }
3293                    if(inSpace)
3294                    {
3295                        inSpace = false;
3296                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3297                    }
3298                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3299                    th += centerLongitude;
3300                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3301                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3302                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3303                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3304                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3305                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3306                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3307                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3308                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3309                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
3310                            , qs, seedB));
3311                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3312                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3313                            , seedC));
3314                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3315                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3316                    if(fresh) {
3317                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3318                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3319
3320                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3321                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3322
3323                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3324                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3325                    }
3326                }
3327                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3328                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3329
3330            }
3331            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3332                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3333                    hMod,
3334                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3335            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3336            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3337            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3338
3339            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3340                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3341                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3342                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3343                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3344                    h = heightData[x][y];
3345                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3346                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3347                        continue;
3348                    }
3349                    else
3350                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3351                    hMod = 1.0;
3352                    switch (t) {
3353                        case 0:
3354                        case 1:
3355                        case 2:
3356                        case 3:
3357                            h = 0.4;
3358                            hMod = 0.2;
3359                            break;
3360                        case 6:
3361                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3362                            break;
3363                        case 7:
3364                            h *= -0.25;
3365                            break;
3366                        case 8:
3367                            h *= -0.4;
3368                            break;
3369                        default:
3370                            h *= 0.05;
3371                    }
3372                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3373                    if (fresh) {
3374                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3375                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3376                    }
3377                }
3378            }
3379            if(fresh)
3380            {
3381                minHeat1 = ps;
3382                maxHeat1 = pc;
3383            }
3384            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3385            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3386            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3387            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3388            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3389
3390
3391            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3392                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3393                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3394                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3395                    if (fresh) {
3396                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3397                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3398                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3399                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3400                    }
3401                }
3402            }
3403            if(fresh)
3404            {
3405                minHeat = qs;
3406                maxHeat = qc;
3407                minWet = ps;
3408                maxWet = pc;
3409            }
3410            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3411        }
3412    }
3413    /**
3414     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape that resembles a
3415     * mix part-way between an ellipse and a rectangle. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3416     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3417     * distortion around all the edges than the other maps here, especially when comparing the North and South poles
3418     * with RoundSideMap.
3419     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobler_hyperelliptical_projection">Tobler hyperelliptical projection</a>.
3420     * <a href="">Example map</a>
3421     */
3422    @Beta
3423    public static class HyperellipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3424        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3425        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3426                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3427                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3428
3429        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3430        public final double[][] xPositions,
3431                yPositions,
3432                zPositions;
3433        protected final int[] edges;
3434        private final double alpha, kappa, epsilon;
3435        private final double[] Z;
3436

3439         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3440         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.

3442         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3443         * If you were using {@link HyperellipticalMap#HyperellipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3444         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.

3481        /**
3482         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3483         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3484         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3485         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3486         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3487         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3488         *
3489         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3490         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3491         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3492         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3493         */
3494        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
3495            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
3496        }

3502         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3503         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.

3505         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.

3508         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

3516        /**
3517         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3518         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3519         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3520         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3521         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3522         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3523         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3524         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3525         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3526         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3527         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3528         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3529         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3530         * that don't require zooming.
3531         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3532         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3533         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3534         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3535         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3536         */
3537        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier){
3538            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier, 0.0625, 2.5);
3539        }

3541        /**
3542         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3543         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3544         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3545         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3546         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3547         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3548         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3549         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3550         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3551         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3552         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3553         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3554         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3555         * that don't require zooming.
3556         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3557         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3558         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3559         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3560         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3561         * @param alpha one of the Tobler parameters;  0.0625 is the default and this can range from 0.0 to 1.0 at least
3562         * @param kappa one of the Tobler parameters; 2.5 is the default but 2.0-5.0 range values are also often used
3563         */
3564        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator,
3565                                  double octaveMultiplier, double alpha, double kappa){
3566            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3567            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3568            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3569            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3570            edges = new int[height << 1];
3571            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3572            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3573            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3574            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3575            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3576            this.alpha = alpha;
3577            this.kappa = kappa;
3578            this.Z = new double[height << 2];
3579            this.epsilon = ProjectionTools.simpsonIntegrateHyperellipse(0.0, 1.0, 0.25 / height, kappa);
3580            ProjectionTools.simpsonODESolveHyperellipse(1, this.Z, 0.25 / height, alpha, kappa, epsilon);
3581        }
3582        /**
3583         * Copies the HyperellipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3584         * be shared to Noise classes.
3585         * @param other a HyperellipticalMap to copy
3586         */
3587        public HyperellipticalMap(HyperellipticalMap other)
3588        {
3589            super(other);
3590            terrain = other.terrain;
3591            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
3592            heat = other.heat;
3593            moisture = other.moisture;
3594            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
3595            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
3596            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
3597            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
3598            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
3599            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
3600            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
3601            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
3602            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
3603            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
3604            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
3605            alpha = other.alpha;
3606            kappa = other.kappa;
3607            epsilon = other.epsilon;
3608            Z = Arrays.copyOf(other.Z, other.Z.length);
3609        }

3612        @Override
3613        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3614            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3615            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3616                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3617            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3618                return edges[y << 1];
3619            else return x;
3620        }
3621
3622        @Override
3623        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3624            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3625        }
3626
3627        /**
3628         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
3629         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
3630         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
3631         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
3632         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
3633         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
3634         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
3635         *
3636         * @param latitude  the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
3637         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
3638         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
3639         */
3640        @Override
3641        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
3642            final double z0 = Math.abs(NumberTools.sin(latitude));
3643            final int i = Arrays.binarySearch(Z, z0);
3644            final double y;
3645            if (i >= 0)
3646                y = i/(Z.length-1.);
3647            else if (-i-1 >= Z.length)
3648                y = Z[Z.length-1];
3649            else
3650                y = ((z0-Z[-i-2])/(Z[-i-1]-Z[-i-2]) + (-i-2))/(Z.length-1.);
3651            final int xx = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*Math.pow(1 - Math.pow(Math.abs(y),kappa), 1/kappa)) + 0.5);
3652            final int yy = (int)(y * Math.signum(latitude) * height * 0.5 + 0.5);
3653            return Coord.get(wrapX(xx, yy), wrapY(xx, yy));
3654        }
3655
3656        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3657                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3658        {
3659            boolean fresh = false;
3660            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3661            {
3662                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3663                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3664                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3665                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3666                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3667                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3668                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3669                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3670                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3671                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3672                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3673                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3674                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3675                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3676                cacheA = stateA;
3677                cacheB = stateB;
3678                fresh = true;
3679            }
3680            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3681            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3682            int t;
3683
3684            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3685            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3686
3687            double p,
3688                    ps, pc,
3689                    qs, qc,
3690                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3691                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3692                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3693                    th, lon,
3694                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = Math.PI / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3695                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3696
3697            yPos = startY - ry;
3698            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3699//                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3700//                thb = asin(thy);
3701//                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3702//                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3703//                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3704//                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3705//                lat = asin(qs);
3706//
3707//                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3708
3709                lon = NumberTools.asin(Z[(int)(0.5 + Math.abs(yPos*iry)*(Z.length-1))])*Math.signum(yPos);
3710                qs = NumberTools.sin(lon);
3711                qc = NumberTools.cos(lon);
3712
3713                boolean inSpace = true;
3714                xPos = startX - hw;
3715                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3716                    //th = lon * xPos;
3717                    th = xPos * irx / Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*ProjectionTools.hyperellipse(yPos * iry, kappa));
3718                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3719                        //if(th < -2.0 || th > 2.0) {
3720                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3721                        inSpace = true;
3722                        continue;
3723                    }
3724                    if(inSpace)
3725                    {
3726                        inSpace = false;
3727                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3728                    }
3729                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3730                    th += centerLongitude;
3731                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3732                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3733                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3734                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3735                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3736                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3737                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3738                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3739                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3740                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB + seedC)
3741                            , qs, seedB));
3742                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3743                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3744                            , seedC));
3745                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3746                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3747                    if(fresh) {
3748                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3749                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3750
3751                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3752                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3753
3754                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3755                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3756                    }
3757                }
3758                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3759                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3760
3761            }
3762            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3763                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3764                    hMod,
3765                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3766            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3767            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3768            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3769
3770            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3771                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3772                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3773                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3774                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3775                    h = heightData[x][y];
3776                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3777                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3778                        continue;
3779                    }
3780                    else
3781                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3782                    hMod = 1.0;
3783                    switch (t) {
3784                        case 0:
3785                        case 1:
3786                        case 2:
3787                        case 3:
3788                            h = 0.4;
3789                            hMod = 0.2;
3790                            break;
3791                        case 6:
3792                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3793                            break;
3794                        case 7:
3795                            h *= -0.25;
3796                            break;
3797                        case 8:
3798                            h *= -0.4;
3799                            break;
3800                        default:
3801                            h *= 0.05;
3802                    }
3803                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3804                    if (fresh) {
3805                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3806                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3807                    }
3808                }
3809            }
3810            if(fresh)
3811            {
3812                minHeat1 = ps;
3813                maxHeat1 = pc;
3814            }
3815            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3816            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3817            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3818            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3819            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3820
3821
3822            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3823                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3824                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3825                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3826                    if (fresh) {
3827                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3828                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3829                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3830                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3831                    }
3832                }
3833            }
3834            if(fresh)
3835            {
3836                minHeat = qs;
3837                maxHeat = qc;
3838                minWet = ps;
3839                maxWet = pc;
3840            }
3841            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3842        }
3843    }

3845    /**
3846     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
3847     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
3848     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_projection">Hammer projection</a>, so the latitude
3849     * lines are curved instead of flat. The Mollweide projection that {@link EllipticalMap} uses has flat lines, but
3850     * the two projection are otherwise very similar, and are both equal-area (Hammer tends to have less significant
3851     * distortion around the edges, but the curvature of the latitude lines can be hard to visualize).
3852     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nmN6lMK.gifv">Preview image link of a world rotating</a>.
3853     */
3854    @Beta
3855    public static class EllipticalHammerMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3856        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3857        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3858        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3859                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3860                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3861
3862        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3863        public final double[][] xPositions,
3864                yPositions,
3865                zPositions;
3866        protected final int[] edges;
3867
3868
3869        /**
3870         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3871         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3872         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3873         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3874         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3875         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3876         * If you were using {@link EllipticalHammerMap#EllipticalHammerMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3877         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
3878         */
3879        public EllipticalHammerMap() {
3880            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3881        }
3882
3883        /**
3884         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3885         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3886         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3887         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3888         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3889         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
3890         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3891         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3892         *
3893         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3894         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3895         */
3896        public EllipticalHammerMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3897            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
3898        }

3900        /**
3901         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3902         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3903         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3904         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3905         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3906         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3907         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3908         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3909         *
3910         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3911         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3912         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3913         */
3914        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3915            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3916        }

3918        /**
3919         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3920         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3921         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3922         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3923         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3924         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3925         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3926         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3927         *
3928         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3929         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3930         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3931         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3932         */
3933        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
3934            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
3935        }

3937        /**
3938         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3939         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3940         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3941         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3942         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3943         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3944         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3945         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3946         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
3947         *
3948         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3949         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3950         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3951         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3952         */
3953        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
3954            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
3955        }
3956
3957        /**
3958         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3959         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3960         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3961         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3962         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3963         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3964         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3965         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3966         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3967         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3968         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3969         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3970         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3971         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3972         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3973         * that don't require zooming.
3974         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3975         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3976         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3977         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3978         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3979         */
3980        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3981            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3982            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3983            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3984            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3985            edges = new int[height << 1];
3986            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3987            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3988//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
3989//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
3990            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3991            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3992            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3993        }

3995        /**
3996         * Copies the EllipticalHammerMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3997         * be shared to Noise classes.
3998         * @param other an EllipticalHammerMap to copy
3999         */
4000        public EllipticalHammerMap(EllipticalHammerMap other)
4001        {
4002            super(other);
4003            terrain = other.terrain;
4004            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4005            heat = other.heat;
4006            moisture = other.moisture;
4007            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4008            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4009            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4010            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4011            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4012            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4013            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4014            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4015            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4016            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4017            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4018        }
4019
4020        @Override
4021        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
4022            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4023            if(x < edges[y << 1])
4024                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
4025            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
4026                return edges[y << 1];
4027            else return x;
4028        }
4029
4030        @Override
4031        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4032            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4033        }
4034
4035        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4036                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4037        {
4038            boolean fresh = false;
4039            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4040            {
4041                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4042                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4043                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4044                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4045                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4046                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4047                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4048                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4049                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4050                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4051                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4052                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4053                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4054                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4055                cacheA = stateA;
4056                cacheB = stateB;
4057                fresh = true;
4058            }
4059            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4060            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4061            int t;
4062
4063            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
4064            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4065
4066            double p,
4067                    ps, pc,
4068                    qs, qc,
4069                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
4070                    z, th, lon, lat,
4071                    rx = width * 0.5, hw = width * 0.5, root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0),
4072                    irx = 1.0 / rx, iry = 2.0 / (double) height,
4073                    xAdj, yAdj,
4074                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)(width),
4075                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)(height);
4076
4077            yPos = (startY - height * 0.5);
4078            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4079                boolean inSpace = true;
4080                yAdj = yPos * iry;
4081                xPos = (startX - hw);
4082                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4083                    xAdj = xPos * irx;
4084                    z = Math.sqrt(1.0 - 0.5 * xAdj * xAdj - 0.5 * yAdj * yAdj);
4085                    th = z * yAdj * root2;
4086                    lon = 2.0 * NumberTools.atan2((2.0 * z * z - 1.0), (z * xAdj * root2));
4087                    if(th != th || lon < 0.0) {
4088                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
4089                        inSpace = true;
4090                        continue;
4091                    }
4092                    lat = NumberTools.asin(th);
4093                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
4094                    qs = th;
4095                    th = Math.PI - lon + centerLongitude;
4096                    if(inSpace)
4097                    {
4098                        inSpace = false;
4099                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4100                    }
4101                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4102                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
4103                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
4104                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
4105                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
4106                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4107                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
4108                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4109                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4110                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
4111                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
4112                            , qs, seedB));
4113                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
4114                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
4115                            , seedC));
4116                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4117                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4118                    if(fresh) {
4119                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4120                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4121
4122                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4123                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4124
4125                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4126                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4127                    }
4128                }
4129                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4130                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4131
4132            }
4133            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4134                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4135                    hMod,
4136                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
4137            yPos = startY + i_uh;
4138            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4139            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4140
4141            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4142                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
4143                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
4144                temp = 2.2 - temp;
4145                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4146                    h = heightData[x][y];
4147                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
4148                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4149                        continue;
4150                    }
4151                    else
4152                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4153                    hMod = 1.0;
4154                    switch (t) {
4155                        case 0:
4156                        case 1:
4157                        case 2:
4158                        case 3:
4159                            h = 0.4;
4160                            hMod = 0.2;
4161                            break;
4162                        case 6:
4163                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4164                            break;
4165                        case 7:
4166                            h *= -0.25;
4167                            break;
4168                        case 8:
4169                            h *= -0.4;
4170                            break;
4171                        default:
4172                            h *= 0.05;
4173                    }
4174                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
4175                    if (fresh) {
4176                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4177                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4178                    }
4179                }
4180            }
4181            if(fresh)
4182            {
4183                minHeat1 = ps;
4184                maxHeat1 = pc;
4185            }
4186            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4187            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4188            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4189            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4190            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4191
4192
4193            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4194                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4195                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4196                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4197                    if (fresh) {
4198                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4199                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4200                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4201                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4202                    }
4203                }
4204            }
4205            if(fresh)
4206            {
4207                minHeat = qs;
4208                maxHeat = qc;
4209                minWet = ps;
4210                maxWet = pc;
4211            }
4212            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4213        }
4214    }

4217
4218    /**
4219     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
4220     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). It should
4221     * look as a world would when viewed from space, and implements rotation differently to allow the planet to be
4222     * rotated without recalculating all the data, though it cannot zoom. Note that calling
4223     * {@link #setCenterLongitude(double)} does a lot more work than in other classes, but less than fully calling
4224     * {@link #generate()} in those classes, since it doesn't remake the map data at a slightly different rotation and
4225     * instead keeps a single map in use the whole time, using sections of it. This uses an
4226     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
4227     * the latitude always at the equator; the internal map is stored as a {@link SphereMap}, which uses a
4228     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylindrical_equal-area_projection#Discussion">cylindrical equal-area
4229     * projection</a>, specifically the Smyth equal-surface projection.
4230     * <br>
4231     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WNa5nQ1.gifv">Example view of a planet rotating</a>.
4232     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/NV5IMd6.gifv">Another example</a>.
4233     */
4234    @Beta
4235    public static class RotatingSpaceMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4236        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4237                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4238                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4239
4240        public final double[][] xPositions,
4241                yPositions,
4242                zPositions;
4243        protected final int[] edges;
4244        public final SphereMap storedMap;
4245        /**
4246         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4247         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4248         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
4249         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4250         * If you were using {@link RotatingSpaceMap#RotatingSpaceMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
4251         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4252         */
4253        public RotatingSpaceMap() {
4254            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4255        }
4256
4257        /**
4258         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4259         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4260         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4261         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4262         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4263         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4264         *
4265         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4266         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4267         */
4268        public RotatingSpaceMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4269            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4270        }

4273         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,

4275         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4276         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4277         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4278         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4279         *
4280         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4281         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4282         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4283         */
4284        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {

4286        }

4299         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal

4322        /**
4323         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4324         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4325         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4326         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4327         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4328         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4329         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4330         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4331         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4332         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4333         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4334         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4335         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4336         * that don't require zooming.
4337         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4338         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4339         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4340         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4341         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4342         */
4343        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4344            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4345            xPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4346            yPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4347            zPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4348            edges = new int[height << 1];
4349            storedMap = new SphereMap(initialSeed, mapWidth << 1, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4350        }
