4352        /**
4353         * Copies the RotatingSpaceMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4354         * be shared to Noise classes.
4355         * @param other a RotatingSpaceMap to copy
4356         */
4357        public RotatingSpaceMap(RotatingSpaceMap other)
4358        {
4359            super(other);
4360            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4361            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4362            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4363            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4364            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4365            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4366            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4367            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4368            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4369            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4370            storedMap = new SphereMap(other.storedMap);
4371        }
4372
4373
4374        @Override
4375        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
4376            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4377            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
4378        }
4379
4380        @Override
4381        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4382            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4383        }
4384
4385        @Override
4386        public void setCenterLongitude(double centerLongitude) {
4387            super.setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4388            int ax, ay;
4389            double
4390                    ps, pc,
4391                    qs, qc,
4392                    h, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
4393                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
4394                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
4395                    th, lon, lat, rho,
4396                    i_pi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
4397                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
4398                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
4399
4400            yPos = startY - ry;
4401            iyPos = yPos / ry;
4402            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
4403                boolean inSpace = true;
4404                xPos = startX - rx;
4405                ixPos = xPos / rx;
4406                lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
4407                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
4408                    rho = (ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
4409                    if(rho > 1.0) {
4410                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4411                        inSpace = true;
4412                        continue;
4413                    }
4414                    rho = Math.sqrt(rho);
4415                    if(inSpace)
4416                    {
4417                        inSpace = false;
4418                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4419                    }
4420                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4421                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
4422                    lon = removeExcess((centerLongitude + (NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th)))) * 0.5);
4423
4424                    qs = lat * 0.6366197723675814;
4425                    qc = qs + 1.0;
4426                    int sf = (qs >= 0.0 ? (int) qs : (int) qs - 1) & -2;
4427                    int cf = (qc >= 0.0 ? (int) qc : (int) qc - 1) & -2;
4428                    qs -= sf;
4429                    qc -= cf;
4430                    qs *= 2.0 - qs;
4431                    qc *= 2.0 - qc;
4432                    qs = qs * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qs) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4433                    qc = qc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4434
4435
4436                    ps = lon * 0.6366197723675814;
4437                    pc = ps + 1.0;
4438                    sf = (ps >= 0.0 ? (int) ps : (int) ps - 1) & -2;
4439                    cf = (pc >= 0.0 ? (int) pc : (int) pc - 1) & -2;
4440                    ps -= sf;
4441                    pc -= cf;
4442                    ps *= 2.0 - ps;
4443                    pc *= 2.0 - pc;
4444                    ps = ps * (-0.775 - 0.225 * ps) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4445                    pc = pc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * pc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4446
4447                    ax = (int)((lon * i_pi + 1.0) * width);
4448                    ay = (int)((qs + 1.0) * ry);
4449                    
4450//                    // Hammer projection, not an inverse projection like we usually use
4451//                    z = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(1 + qc * NumberTools.cos(lon * 0.5));
4452//                    ax = (int)((qc * NumberTools.sin(lon * 0.5) * z + 1.0) * width);
4453//                    ay = (int)((qs * z + 1.0) * height * 0.5);
4454
4455                    if(ax >= storedMap.width || ax < 0 || ay >= storedMap.height || ay < 0)
4456                    {
4457                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4458                        continue;
4459                    }
4460                    if(storedMap.heightCodeData[ax][ay] >= 1000) // for the seam we get when looping around
4461                    {
4462                        ay = storedMap.wrapY(ax, ay);
4463                        ax = storedMap.wrapX(ax, ay);
4464                    }
4465
4466                    xPositions[x][y] = pc * qc;
4467                    yPositions[x][y] = ps * qc;
4468                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4469
4470                    heightData[x][y] = h = storedMap.heightData[ax][ay];
4471                    heightCodeData[x][y] = codeHeight(h);
4472                    heatData[x][y] = storedMap.heatData[ax][ay];
4473                    moistureData[x][y] = storedMap.moistureData[ax][ay];
4474
4475                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4476                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4477                }
4478                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4479                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4480            }
4481
4482        }
4483
4484        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4485                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4486        {
4487            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB)// || landMod != storedMap.landModifier || coolMod != storedMap.coolingModifier)
4488            {
4489                storedMap.regenerate(0, 0, width << 1, height, landMod, heatMod, stateA, stateB);
4490                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4491                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4492
4493                minHeight = storedMap.minHeight;
4494                maxHeight = storedMap.maxHeight;
4495
4496                minHeat0 = storedMap.minHeat0;
4497                maxHeat0 = storedMap.maxHeat0;
4498
4499                minHeat1 = storedMap.minHeat1;
4500                maxHeat1 = storedMap.maxHeat1;
4501
4502                minWet0 = storedMap.minWet0;
4503                maxWet0 = storedMap.maxWet0;
4504
4505                minHeat = storedMap.minHeat;
4506                maxHeat = storedMap.maxHeat;
4507
4508                minWet = storedMap.minWet;
4509                maxWet = storedMap.maxWet;
4510
4511                cacheA = stateA;
4512                cacheB = stateB;
4513            }
4514            setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4515            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4516        }
4517    }
4518    /**
4519     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that does no projection of the map, as if the area were
4520     * completely flat or small enough that curvature is impossible to see. This also does not change heat levels at the
4521     * far north and south regions of the map, since it is meant for areas that are all about the same heat level.
4522     */
4523    public static class LocalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4524        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
4525        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
4526        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4527                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4528                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4529
4530        public final Noise.Ridged2D terrain, otherRidged;
4531        public final Noise.InverseLayered2D heat, moisture, terrainLayered;
4532        public final double[][] xPositions,
4533                yPositions,
4534                zPositions;

4539         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4540         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4541         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
4542         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4543         * If you were using {@link LocalMap#LocalMap(long, int, int, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4544         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4545         */
4546        public LocalMap() {

4551         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4552         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4553         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4554         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4555         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4556         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4557         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4558         *

4560         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4561         */
4562        public LocalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4563            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4564        }

4566        /**
4567         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4568         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4569         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4570         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4571         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4572         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4573         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4574         *
4575         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4576         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4577         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4578         */
4579        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4580            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4581        }

4583        /**
4584         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4585         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4586         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4587         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4588         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4589         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4590         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4591         *
4592         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4593         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4594         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4595         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4596         */
4597        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4598            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4599        }

4601        /**
4602         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4603         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4604         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4605         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4606         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4607         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4608         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4609         *
4610         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4611         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4612         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4613         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4614         */
4615        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {

4619        /**
4620         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4621         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4622         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4623         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4624         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4625         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4626         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4627         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4628         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4629         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4630         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4631         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4632         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4633         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4634         * that don't require zooming.
4635         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4636         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4637         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4638         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
4639         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4640         */
4641        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4642            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4643            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4644            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4645            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4646
4647            terrain = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
4648            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4649            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4650            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4651            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
4652        }

4654        /**
4655         * Copies the LocalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4656         * be shared to Noise classes.
4657         * @param other a LocalMap to copy
4658         */
4659        public LocalMap(LocalMap other)
4660        {
4661            super(other);
4662            terrain = other.terrain;
4663            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4664            heat = other.heat;
4665            moisture = other.moisture;
4666            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4667            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4668            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4669            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4670            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4671            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4672            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4673            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4674            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4675            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4676        }

4678        @Override
4679        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4680            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4681        }
4682        
4683        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4684                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4685        {
4686            boolean fresh = false;
4687            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4688            {
4689                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4690                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4691                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4692                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4693                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4694                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4695                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4696                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4697                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4698                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4699                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4700                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4701                cacheA = stateA;
4702                cacheB = stateB;
4703                fresh = true;
4704            }
4705            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4706            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4707            int t;
4708
4709            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4710            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4711
4712            double p,
4713                    ps, pc,
4714                    qs, qc,
4715                    h, temp,
4716                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
4717                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4718            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) { 
4719                xPos = startX * i_w;
4720                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4721                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
4722                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
4723                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4724                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4725                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4726                            yPos, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4727                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4728                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4729                            seedB));
4730                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4731                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4732
4733                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4734                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4735                    if(fresh) {
4736                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4737                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4738
4739                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4740                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4741
4742                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4743                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4744                    }
4745                }
4746                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4747                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4748
4749            }
4750            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4751                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4752                    hMod;
4753            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4754            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4755            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4756
4757            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4758                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4759                    h = heightData[x][y];
4760                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4761                    hMod = 1.0;
4762                    switch (t) {
4763                        case 0:
4764                        case 1:
4765                        case 2:
4766                        case 3:
4767                            h = 0.4;
4768                            hMod = 0.2;
4769                            break;
4770                        case 6:
4771                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4772                            break;
4773                        case 7:
4774                            h *= -0.25;
4775                            break;
4776                        case 8:
4777                            h *= -0.4;
4778                            break;
4779                        default:
4780                            h *= 0.05;
4781                    }
4782                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4783                    if (fresh) {
4784                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4785                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4786                    }
4787                }
4788            }
4789            if(fresh)
4790            {
4791                minHeat1 = ps;
4792                maxHeat1 = pc;
4793            }
4794            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4795            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4796            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4797            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4798            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4799
4800
4801            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4802                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4803                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4804                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4805                    if (fresh) {
4806                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4807                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4808                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4809                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4810                    }
4811                }
4812            }
4813            if(fresh)
4814            {
4815                minHeat = qs;
4816                maxHeat = qc;
4817                minWet = ps;
4818                maxWet = pc;
4819            }
4820            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4821        }
4822    }

4824    /**
4825     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing local map (such as a map of Australia, which it can do by
4826     * default), without applying any projection or changing heat levels in the polar regions or equator.
4827     */
4828    public static class LocalMimicMap extends LocalMap
4829    {
4830        public GreasedRegion earth;
4831        public GreasedRegion shallow;
4832        public GreasedRegion coast;
4833        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
4834        /**

4895         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
4896         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
4897         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
4898         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
4899         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
4900         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
4901         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4902         *

4904         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4905         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4906         */

4911        /**
4912         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4913         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
4914         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
4915         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
4916         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
4917         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4918         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4919         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4920         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4921         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4922         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4923         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4924         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4925         * that don't require zooming.
4926         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4927         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4928         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4929         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4930         */
4931        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4932            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4933            earth = toMimic;
4934            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
4935            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
4936            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
4937        }

4970        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4971                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4972        {
4973            boolean fresh = false;
4974            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4975            {
4976                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4977                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4978                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4979                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4980                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4981                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4982                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4983                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4984                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4985                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4986                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4987                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4988                cacheA = stateA;
4989                cacheB = stateB;
4990                fresh = true;
4991            }
4992            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4993            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4994            int t;
4995
4996            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4997            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4998
4999            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
5000
5001            if(zoom > 0)
5002            {
5003                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
5004                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
5005                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
5006                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
5007                }
5008                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5009                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5010            }
5011            else
5012            {
5013                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
5014                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
5015            }
5016            double p,
5017                    ps, pc,
5018                    qs, qc,
5019                    h, temp,
5020                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
5021                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
5022            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5023                xPos = startX * i_w;
5024                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
5025                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
5026                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
5027                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
5028
5029                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
5030                    {
5031                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5032                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5033                                yPos, seedA)) * 0.85;
5034                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
5035                            h += 0.05;
5036                        else
5037                            h += 0.15;
5038                    }
5039                    else
5040                    {
5041                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5042                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5043                                yPos, seedA)) * -0.9;
5044                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
5045                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
5046                        else
5047                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
5048                    }
5049                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
5050                    heightData[x][y] = h;
5051                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
5052                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
5053                            seedB));
5054                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
5055                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
5056
5057                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
5058                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
5059                    if(fresh) {
5060                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
5061                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
5062
5063                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
5064                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
5065
5066                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
5067                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
5068                    }
5069                }
5070                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
5071                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
5072
5073            }
5074            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
5075                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
5076                    hMod;
5077            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
5078            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5079            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5080
5081            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5082                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5083                    h = heightData[x][y];
5084                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
5085                    hMod = 1.0;
5086                    switch (t) {
5087                        case 0:
5088                        case 1:
5089                        case 2:
5090                        case 3:
5091                            h = 0.4;
5092                            hMod = 0.2;
5093                            break;
5094                        case 6:
5095                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
5096                            break;
5097                        case 7:
5098                            h *= -0.25;
5099                            break;
5100                        case 8:
5101                            h *= -0.4;
5102                            break;
5103                        default:
5104                            h *= 0.05;
5105                    }
5106                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
5107                    if (fresh) {
5108                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
5109                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
5110                    }
5111                }
5112            }
5113            if(fresh)
5114            {
5115                minHeat1 = ps;
5116                maxHeat1 = pc;
5117            }
5118            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
5119            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5120            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5121            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5122            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5123
5124
5125            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
5126                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5127                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
5128                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
5129                    if (fresh) {
5130                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
5131                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
5132                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
5133                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
5134                    }
5135                }
5136            }
5137            if(fresh)
5138            {
5139                minHeat = qs;
5140                maxHeat = qc;
5141                minWet = ps;
5142                maxWet = pc;
5143            }
5144            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
5145        }
5146    }
5147}
